snippet.textDisplay:
This song bring about melancholy, so it makes it easier to come to term with your feelings and express them.
You're just sitting there, sad yet smiling, as if there is something inherently beautiful about been sad, a sense of happiness and comfort in facing and been overwhelmed by these dark thoughts you usually run from, and instead of been hurt by them like you usually do, you just bask in them, at peace.
The observatory's song really does it's job.

snippet.textDisplay:
I’m coming back to this many years later, so don’t mind me...
I got this game when I was very young, probably no older than 7, sometime around 2010. I then proceeded to only get as far as the third boss before it was lost...
I rebought it a few months ago. I played through it. It reminded me of so many sweet emotions, and it really meant a lot to me. 
I hope this game gets a remake, at least so more people appreciate it. This has always been the best soundtrack in the game to me, and easily in my top ten of all time. The peacefulness has gotten me through a lot. So thank you, Dragon Quest IX. You’ll always hold a special place in my heart.

snippet.textDisplay:
Oh Lord, we did what we had to do.

We prayed and we followed through,
we watched over these lands
oh father clean  our hands
For we weep today.

You said, "now grow these righteous fruits,
protect--that's what you're made to do!
And maybe sometime soon,
or in a thousand moons,
you may come home to me."

Oh lord,
we worked so hard
to protect,
your forsaken human flock

and now our golden chariot,
A train aloft in the sky
Opens its doors to us
To carry us up above-

What is this noise we hear?

Red beams shot up from below,
But alas we were too slow,
They shot our golden train
And made the righteous rain,
As the fruits toppled below.

Oh Lord, whatever did we do?
We prayed, and we followed through!
You asked us your demands,
And we followed them as planned
But now you have betrayed us.

We watched
Our brothers fall,
Their wings
Drifting like fallen snow.

We stand above the wreckage
Trapped in our castle of betrayal from above
With consequences from

The realm of chaos down below

What is this we see so gold?

And comes a hero from our realm,
A girl whose wings and halo fell,
She rides the golden train,
The righteous fruits in reign,
And helps us return from our hell

We flew to Lord’s realm up above,
And found he too had been struck
From the red beams that he sent,
What could this have meant?
Had the attack not come from him?

We find,
It was one of,
Our own,
his hatred directed above

And our brave hero fought him,
She was successful in the battle
But she was sent back to the people

For without wings, she was human.

If anywhere some angelic guy or woman can see this - i want to thank you

And now the tracks over and i return into depressions reminding me constantly my only sense in living is going to school to make money to survive in an horrible world..

snippet.textDisplay:
First, it's a quest you have to "download" (it's not possible anymore to download it but you can still unlock it with cheat codes). Then you have to perform quests 146, 147, 148, 149, to access quest 150, and the secret room of the Orion express. There is a boss the first time you go in there, with around 5000 HP.

It's a little long to do, but it's a real additional part of the scenario you will see, that way... I won't spoil you the rest ;)

snippet.textDisplay:
@XTheslendermanxX
You forgot a comma.  When speaking in the second person, in this case to "spelling and grammar", it is important to never forget that comma.

"Let's eat grandma."
"Let's eat, grandma." 

See the difference?  Proper punctuation saves lives too!  Word to the wise: Do not expect perfection on the internet; it wasn't back in 1995, and it won't ever be.


Also, your and you're are different; please use them properly.
